articles.title: How Does ChatGPT Work?
articles.description: Breaks down the ChatGPT product stack: user interface, transformer model, and GPU-backed infrastructure for real-time inference.

articles.title: Memory in Agentic AI
articles.description: Introduces structured memory layers for AI agents — from per-interaction to long-term memory — and their implications for system design.

articles.title: RAG Strategy and Tooling
articles.description: In this article, we walk through three types of RAG strategies, the tradeoffs behind each, and how to choose appropriate tooling for your context.

articles.title: Why are Vector Databases Difficult? A Deep Dive
articles.description: This article explores the core difficulties of vector databases.

articles.title: Categorical Encoding for Machine Learning
articles.description: A guide to choosing the right categorical encoding method for your ML model.

articles.title: LLM Evaluation Metrics
articles.description: Evaluating large language models remains one of the more challenging aspects of deploying AI systems in production.

articles.title: Sampling Strategies
articles.description: Imbalanced datasets create a fundamental challenge: machine learning models naturally gravitate towards predicting the majority class.

articles.title: LLM Training Fundamentals: From Tokens to Human Preference
articles.description: Explores the mathematical foundations of language model training (tokens, embeddings, softmax) and how human preference ranking introduces alignment biases that cannot be captured by statistical metrics.

articles.title: Filtered Vector Search
articles.description: Examines how metadata integration in vector indexes affects query execution and how multiple ranking signals can be combined in production systems.

articles.title: Cost of ML
articles.description: Breaks down the F(X)=Y structure of ML projects, covering data, compute, labelling, and how to make financially sound deployment decisions.

articles.title: Machine Learning Design Patterns
articles.description: Outlines reusable solution patterns in ML engineering — like classification, recommendation, and segmentation — and how they relate to business goals.

articles.title: Alignment: Semantics in the AI/ML Era
articles.description: Explores how abstraction in AI systems has shifted semantic responsibility from code syntax to goal alignment, and how engineers must adapt to this new landscape.

articles.title: 5 Mistakes to Avoid When Building Your First AI Product
articles.description: Highlights common pitfalls in early AI product development, from overbuilding to ignoring deployment and cost structure.

articles.title: How to Brief a Developer on a Feature Without Being Technical
articles.description: A practical guide for business and product owners to communicate clearly with AI engineers without needing to write code.

articles.title: MLE vs SWE
articles.description: In software engineering, success is defined by delivery. Machine learning projects rarely follow this pattern. Success is based on iteration.

articles.title: Metrics for Business Goals
articles.description: How to choose evaluation metrics that align with business objectives. Covers precision vs recall trade-offs, cost-sensitive evaluation, and business-specific metrics with practical examples.

articles.title: The Indirection Problem: How Programming Concepts Explain Modern Frustrations
articles.description: Explores how C programming's indirection pattern mirrors modern platform economy issues with accountability and complexity.

articles.title: Capital, Labour, and the Productivity Question
articles.description: The capital-labour productivity dynamic, the distinction between exploration and exploitation phases, and what this framework reveals about automation adoption and economic structure.

articles.title: What Data Do I Need?
articles.description: Provides a structured approach for assessing data availability, modality, labelling strategy, and how to turn datasets into ML-ready resources.

articles.title: Leveraging AI for Organisational Intelligence
articles.description: Shows how communication metadata and structured extraction can reveal organisational structure, workforce engagement, and leadership alignment.

articles.title: What is Data Maturity?
articles.description: Data maturity refers to the degree to which an organisation can trust, access, and make use of its data in consistent, scalable, and repeatable ways.

articles.title: How to Isolate Bad Training Data
articles.description: Using cross-validation as a diagnostic tool to systematically identify problematic records in training datasets.

articles.title: SQL Schema Documentation for RAG Pipelines
articles.description: Well-documented schemas serve as a practical form of data governance and provide a semantic layer between raw database structures and their business meaning.

articles.title: Security Risks in AI Systems with Public Access
articles.description: Summarises the threat landscape for public-facing AI: prompt injection, inference attacks, persistent memory exploits, and adversarial queries.

articles.title: SaaS Architecture 101 for Scalability - A Guide for Non-CTOs
articles.description: Provides non-technical founders with a structured overview of architectural choices in SaaS products, including stack selection, microservices, and cost trade-offs.

articles.title: AI Tooling and the Separation Between Coders and Programming
articles.description: AI tooling makes the separation between writing code and building systems more visible and, sometimes, more problematic.

articles.title: Platforms vs Pipelines: Engineering for Compounding Returns
articles.description: Choose to build platforms rather than optimise pipelines. The distinction matters because it determines whether engineering effort produces linear or exponential returns.

articles.title: Scaling Databases: Lessons from Facebook's MySQL Journey
articles.description: Most businesses will never face the scaling challenges that Facebook encountered in its early years. Yet the decisions Facebook made while scaling from thousands to millions of users contain lessons relevant to any growing system

articles.title: Docker Deep Dive
articles.description: Explores the foundational Linux primitives, internals of container images, and key deployment considerations for using Docker in real environments.

articles.title: Deploying Models to AWS Lambda
articles.description: Shows how to wrap an ML model in FastAPI, package it with Docker, and deploy it as a container-based Lambda function with Terraform.

articles.title: Developing with APIs Without Rate Limits: Introducing APICache
articles.description: Describes a lightweight caching proxy for structured API development, with examples from OpenAI, GitHub, and public APIs.

articles.title: The Problem with Faster Horses
articles.description: Reframes foundation models as non-deterministic data stores rather than accelerated human workers, and asks what operations that framing permits.

articles.title: PMFOps: The Missing Pipeline
articles.description: Proposes a third operational layer alongside DevOps and MLOps, built around the synthetic audience as a versioned artefact for testing product-market-fit.
